24800.name: Foundry Entrance - Blast Doors
24800.description:
Massive blast doors of riveted steel stand open, venting clouds of steam
and the rhythmic CHUNK-CHUNK-CHUNK of enormous machinery. The heat hits
you like a wall. Beyond the doors, a corridor of interlocking gears forms
the walls, ceiling, and floor — everything here moves, turns, and meshes
with mechanical precision. Welcome to the Clockwork Foundry.

zone_mechanic.description: Steam pressure controls access to various areas. Pull levers to redirect steam.

south.description: The blast doors open to the Ashlands outside.

24801.name: Intake Corridor
24801.description:
A long corridor lined with conveyor belts carrying raw ore, scrap metal,
and unidentifiable components deeper into the foundry. Mechanical arms
swing overhead, sorting materials with frightening speed and precision.
The noise is deafening — grinding gears, hissing pistons, and the
constant clang of metal on metal.

24802.name: Gear Room Alpha
24802.description:
The walls are made entirely of interlocking gears, ranging from tiny
cogs the size of coins to monstrous wheels thirty feet across. They turn
endlessly, powered by some unseen engine. Step carelessly and the gears
will catch clothing, limbs, or worse. Gaps between the teeth offer
precarious passage.

24803.name: Steam Tunnel Alpha
24803.description:
Pipes of every diameter crisscross this tunnel, many leaking jets of
scalding steam. The air is thick with moisture and heat, reducing
visibility to a few feet. Warning signs in an unknown mechanical script
line the walls. The steam burns exposed skin on contact.

24804.name: Maintenance Bay
24804.description:
Workbenches covered in tools, spare parts, and half-assembled mechanisms
fill this chamber. A partially disassembled clockwork soldier lies on
a central table, its chest cavity open to reveal an intricate nest of
gears and springs. Repair drones buzz around, performing maintenance.

24805.name: Assembly Line Alpha
24805.description:
Clockwork soldiers are assembled here on a massive production line.
Mechanical arms install limbs, torsos, and heads with assembly-line
efficiency. Completed units stand at the end, eyes dark, waiting for
the spark of animation. Some twitch sporadically, their gears settling.

24806.name: Lever Room Alpha
24806.description:
A control station with a massive brass lever dominates this room. Gauges,
dials, and pressure meters cover the walls, their needles jumping erratically.
The lever is currently in the UP position. A placard reads: 'STEAM ROUTING
ALPHA — PULL TO REDIRECT.' The choice could open new paths or seal old ones.

zone_mechanic.effect: Pulling this lever redirects steam from Steam Tunnel Alpha, making it safe but flooding Steam Tunnel Beta.

24807.name: Scrap Heap
24807.description:
Mountains of discarded parts, failed prototypes, and worn-out components
fill this chamber nearly to the ceiling. Somewhere in the heap, things
still move — twitching limbs, spinning gears, clicking mandibles.
The scrap is alive with half-functional rejects, cobbled together from
parts never meant to work as one.

24808.name: Assembly Line Beta
24808.description:
This section of the assembly line produces heavier units — steam golems
and siege machines. The scale is staggering. Partially assembled golems
twice the height of a man stand in rows, their boiler-chests still cold.
The assembly arms here are proportionally massive, swinging with bone-
crushing force.

24809.name: Coolant Chamber
24809.description:
Enormous tanks of blue coolant liquid line the walls, connected by a web
of pipes and pumps. The temperature here is mercifully lower, and the
coolant gives off a faint blue glow. Some tanks have cracked, leaking
their contents across the floor in luminous puddles. The coolant smells
of ozone and copper.

24810.name: Steam Tunnel Beta
24810.description:
A secondary steam tunnel, currently dormant. The pipes here are cold and
dry — the steam has been rerouted elsewhere. Condensation drips from
the ceiling, and the silence after the constant roar of the foundry
is almost eerie. Warning placards indicate this tunnel can be flooded
with steam at any moment.

24811.name: Central Junction
24811.description:
A massive circular room where multiple corridors and conveyor systems
converge. A central pillar of spinning gears extends from floor to
ceiling, its purpose unclear but clearly vital — the entire foundry
seems to pulse in time with its rotation. Control panels ring the base.

24812.name: Lever Room Beta
24812.description:
Another control station, identical to the first but controlling different
steam routes. The brass lever here is DOWN. A schematic on the wall shows
the steam routing system — an intricate network of valves and pressure
chambers. Understanding the system is key to navigating the deeper foundry.

zone_mechanic.effect: Pulling this lever redirects steam from Tunnel Beta, opening a shortcut but flooding the Furnace Approach.

24813.name: Tesla Corridor
24813.description:
Towering Tesla coils line both sides of this corridor, their copper tops
crackling with arcs of blue-white electricity. The air smells of ozone
and singed metal. The coils discharge randomly, sending bolts of lightning
screaming across the corridor. Timing your passage is essential.

24814.name: Power Core Observation
24814.description:
A reinforced window looks down into the foundry's power core — a miniature
star contained within a cage of electromagnetic fields. The light is
blinding, the heat immense even through the shielding. This is what
powers the entire complex, an artificial sun harnessed by mechanical genius.

24815.name: Weapons Testing Range
24815.description:
Targets of reinforced steel — many scorched, melted, or riddled with
holes — stand at the far end of this long chamber. Weapon prototypes
line racks along the walls: cannons that fire gears, crossbows powered
by compressed steam, gauntlets that crackle with stored lightning.
Some still fire sporadically at nothing.

24816.name: Pneumatic Shortcut
24816.description:
A pneumatic tube large enough to fit a person runs through this chamber.
A control panel allows you to launch yourself through the tube system,
bypassing large sections of the foundry. The landing, however, is not
gentle. Dents in the receiving chamber's walls attest to this.

north.description: The pneumatic tube shoots you forward!

24817.name: Officer's Quarters
24817.description:
The clockwork officers — larger, more ornate versions of the soldiers —
recharge here in alcoves fitted with power cables. Maps of surface
lands cover the walls, marked with tactical notations. The Foundry
isn't just building an army — it's planning a war.

24818.name: Steam Tunnel Gamma
24818.description:
The deepest steam tunnel runs with superheated vapor so intense that the
stone walls have partially melted and resolidified into glass. Visibility
is zero in the white-hot clouds. Navigation requires blind faith or
intimate knowledge of the layout. The heat is nearly unsurvivable.

zone_mechanic.message: Superheated steam sears your flesh to the bone!

24819.name: Lever Room Gamma
24819.description:
The final lever room. This one is more heavily guarded than the others,
and the lever mechanism is more complex — a series of valves and wheels
rather than a simple pull-lever. Getting the combination right is
essential. Getting it wrong could be catastrophic.

zone_mechanic.effect: Operating this valve system shuts down Steam Tunnel Gamma, clearing the path to the Furnace Core.

24820.name: Pneumatic Landing Chamber
24820.description:
The receiving end of the pneumatic tube system. The walls are heavily
padded — and heavily dented. Crumpled bits of metal and the occasional
bone suggest not everyone (or everything) survives the trip. Multiple
corridors branch from here, leading deeper into the upper foundry.

24821.name: Furnace Approach
24821.description:
The heat here is staggering. The walls glow dull red, and the air
shimmers like a desert mirage. Ahead, the Furnace Core blazes with
the light of a captive star. The approach is lined with inactive
clockwork sentries — they'll activate if the Archon commands it.

24822.name: Furnace Antechamber
24822.description:
The last chamber before the Furnace Core. Emergency systems line the
walls — fire suppression, pressure release, emergency shutdown. All
have been disabled. The doors ahead are sealed with a complex mechanical
lock. Through the viewport, you can see the Archon Prime, standing
motionless at the heart of the inferno, waiting.

24823.name: The Furnace Core
24823.description:
The heart of the Clockwork Foundry blazes before you. A miniature sun
hangs suspended in a cage of electromagnetic coils, bathing everything in
blinding white light. Rivers of molten metal flow through channels in
the floor, feeding the foundry's endless production. At the center,
standing in the inferno as if it were a gentle breeze, is Archon Prime —
the mechanical god of this place. Twenty feet tall, forged from adamantine
and powered by a fragment of the captive star itself, it turns to face
you with eyes of burning plasma. The Foundry's master has been expecting you.

24824.name: Gear Room Beta
24824.description:
A second gear room, but this one has been damaged. Several large gears
have seized, their teeth stripped and shattered. The grinding noise is
terrible, and metal fragments fly like shrapnel. The damage has created
unintended passages through the machinery.

24825.name: Prototype Laboratory
24825.description:
This sealed laboratory contains the Foundry's experimental projects.
Half-finished machines of bizarre design fill the room — flying drones,
submersible golems, weapons that defy conventional understanding. A
massive blueprint on the wall shows Archon Prime's design, annotated
in a mechanical language.

24826.name: Exhaust Vents
24826.description:
Massive exhaust vents dominate this chamber, periodically blasting
superheated air upward with hurricane force. Between blasts, the
vents provide a precarious shortcut through the foundry's upper
levels. Timing is everything — a mistimed crossing means being
blasted into the ceiling.

24827.name: Coal Bunker
24827.description:
Mountains of coal — or something like coal, but blacker and denser —
fill this storage chamber. Automated carts trundle along tracks, carrying
fuel to the furnace. The dust here is thick and flammable. A single
spark could turn this room into an inferno. Mining golems work
tirelessly, breaking apart larger chunks.

24828.name: Compression Chamber
24828.description:
This sealed chamber uses immense mechanical presses to compress raw
materials into building components. The presses slam down with
earth-shaking force every few seconds. Between compressions, the
chamber is navigable — but getting caught between the plates would
reduce anything to a thin sheet of metal.

24829.name: Control Room
24829.description:
The nerve center of the Clockwork Foundry. Banks of switches, levers,
and gauges cover every surface. Pneumatic tubes carry messages between
sections. A massive central display — a mechanical map of the entire
foundry — shows the status of every system in real-time. From here,
the entire complex can be controlled.

24801.name: clockwork soldier
24801.long_desc: A Clockwork Soldier stands at attention, gears whirring within its chest.
24801.description:
This mechanical warrior stands six feet tall, its body a masterwork of
interlocking plates, gears, and pistons. Steam vents from joints as it
moves with surprising fluidity. Its eyes are glass lenses that glow
with an inner amber light, and its hands end in razor-sharp blade-fingers
that can switch to crushing grips in an instant.

24802.name: steam golem
24802.long_desc: A massive Steam Golem lumbers forward, venting clouds of scalding steam.
24802.description:
Twelve feet of iron, brass, and fury. The Steam Golem is a walking
boiler room, its torso a pressurized chamber that vents scalding steam
through nozzles on its arms and back. Its fists are wrecking balls,
and the ground shakes with each thunderous step. The heat radiating
from its body is intense enough to blister skin at ten paces.

24803.name: repair drone
24803.long_desc: A Repair Drone hovers nearby, its many arms performing maintenance.
24803.description:
A floating sphere of polished brass, roughly three feet in diameter,
surrounded by a halo of articulated arms. Each arm ends in a different
tool — wrenches, welders, soldering irons, saws. The drone repairs
damaged units on the battlefield, and can turn its tools to offensive
purposes with disturbing effectiveness.

24804.name: Tesla coil sentry
24804.long_desc: A Tesla Coil Sentry crackles with electrical discharge, scanning for threats.
24804.description:
This stationary defense unit consists of twin Tesla coils mounted on a
rotating base. Arcs of blue-white lightning crackle between the coils,
and the air around it smells of ozone and burning. It can discharge
massive bolts of electricity at anything it identifies as an intruder,
and its targeting systems are devastatingly accurate.

24805.name: Archon Prime
24805.long_desc: ARCHON PRIME towers over you, a mechanical god wreathed in stellar fire!
24805.description:
Archon Prime is the masterwork of the Clockwork Foundry — a mechanical
entity that has transcended mere engineering to become something approaching
divinity. Twenty feet tall, forged from adamantine alloy and powered by a
fragment of captured stellar energy, it moves with the grace of a dancer
and the force of an avalanche. Its body is a cathedral of gears, each
one perfect, each one necessary. Its eyes burn with the light of its
stellar heart, and when it speaks, the foundry itself trembles. It was
built to create. It has decided to conquer.

24801.name: Clockwork Gauntlets
24801.room_desc: A pair of intricate clockwork gauntlets hiss softly with residual steam.

24802.name: Steam-Powered Crossbow
24802.room_desc: A gleaming crossbow powered by a miniature steam engine lies here.

24803.name: Gear of Infinite Motion
24803.room_desc: A small golden gear spins perpetually in midair, defying all known laws.
